Comments_List: I learned a lot of Italian grammar and I got a lot better at speaking Italian.
I learned many more nuances of the language that can help elevate my speaking and understanding closer to the level of a native speaker than simply a student learning from a textbook.

Strengths was that the class was extremely well organized and put the onus on the student to either work hard and do well or the opposite which I liked. There was a lot of responsibility to keep up with the material.
Huge strength is all the speaking practice you get in class.
Most definitely. The Italian department finds the perfect balance of having fun while also learning an immense amount.
